alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 28 at 2:55PM AKST until November 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...PASSING FRONT TO BRING SNOW TO NORTHERN LYNN CANAL... .Northerly winds ahead of a gale force front will bring in below freezing to near freezing temperatures to the northern panhandle tonight and Wednesday. Wednesday afternoon, a front will bring moisture to the panhandle that will last into Thursday. As this moisture collides with the cold air in the north, snow is likely. For the highway and higher elevations near Haines, heavy snow up to 6 inches is expected over a 12 to 15 hour time frame. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Haines Highway and Klukwan. * WHEN...From 3 PM Wednesday to 6 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin along the highway and near the border Wednesday afternoon before moving east towards Haines. The heavier snow is expected to be along the highway with up to 6 inches possible. Heaviest snowfall rates will be late Wednesday evening into early Thursday morning with rates around .5" to 1" per hour. For Haines, and areas closer to sea level, is expected to get lighter amounts of snow, at around 3 inches of snow, with some rain/snow mixing possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. Heavy wet snow will be difficult to manage due to high water content. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
